I was positively surprised by the quality and execution of the dishes at this  establishment.  We had sauteed mussels, amazing iberian ham with tomato rubbed toast, grilled sardines, beef with a foie gras topping, a cheese plate and several other dishes which we shared.  None of the dishes was a disappointment.  My only strike against the place was the wine list, which could have been more extensive - but this is a minor nit.  Pricing was entirely reasonable with no courses over 20 euros.  Lastly, this restaurant passed the "smile test".... everyone at every table positively looked happy - a key metric when judging how good a restaurant really is.  I would recommend Igueldo for an excellent, foodie meal for people who like to experiment.  Overall, a very, very good meal.
